theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures the movement from New to Experienced to Core Contributors but lacks key CoP concepts like legitimate peripheral participation and boundary interactions. Adding variables for peripheral participation effectiveness and community boundary spanning will better model how newcomers gradually become integrated into the community through legitimate participation opportunities and boundary objects.

variables.name: Peripheral Participation Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of newcomers engaging in legitimate peripheral activities

variables.name: Community Boundary Spanning
variables.description: Effectiveness of boundary objects and interactions that connect newcomers to the community

variables.name: Community Identity Strength
variables.description: Accumulated shared identity and mutual engagement within the community

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The current model has implicit and explicit knowledge transfer but doesn't capture the full SECI knowledge spiral. Adding variables for knowledge externalization, combination, and internalization will model how tacit knowledge becomes explicit, gets combined with existing knowledge, and is then internalized by community members, creating a complete knowledge creation cycle.

variables.name: Knowledge Externalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is converted to explicit knowledge

variables.name: Knowledge Combination Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge is combined and systematized

variables.name: Knowledge Internalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge is converted to tacit knowledge through practice

variables.name: Project's Explicit Knowledge Base
variables.description: Accumulated explicit knowledge in documentation, code, and guides

variables.name: Community's Tacit Knowledge
variables.description: Accumulated tacit knowledge held by community members
